definition: impossible to make a living
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
(negative prefix)/not/no
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: They make drinking a habit and cannot live without it.
sentences.chinese: 他们嗜酒成性，没有酒就活不下去。
不动脑子，我就活不下去。

sentences.english: If a man lives in dire poverty, Does that give him the right to be not credible ?
sentences.chinese: 即使一个人穷到活不下去了，就可以不讲信用吗？

sentences.english: Darling, without you, I could not live on.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，没有你，我就活不下去了。

sentences.english: Without rain, many people are going to die.
sentences.chinese: 假如没有水的话很多人都要活不下去了。

sentences.english: You touched on the keyboard even Amie protozoon can't live.
sentences.chinese: 你摸过的键盘上连阿米吧原虫都活不下去。

sentences.english: Gary would not survive and I would not see my son again.
sentences.chinese: 加里将活不下去，而我将不能再次看到我的儿子。

sentences.english: I can't survive outside of the palace.
I can’t survive without this animal.
sentences.chinese: 没有这畜生我活不下去。

sentences.english: Cut your forests down, or over-fish, and these people will not survive.
sentences.chinese: 砍倒森林或过度捕捞，这些人就活不下去。

sentences.english: I really cannot go on living.

sentences.chinese: 没有水，我们就活不下去。

definition: to starve to death/to be very hungry
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
extremely/awfully
lit. drink the northwest wind (idiom); cold and hungry
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to be without food or clothing (idiom)/to be very poor
through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
labor/physical work
to live one's life/to make a living
to beg (for food or money)
to go hungry/to starve
mortal
to survive/to keep on living
to hound sb to death
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
